process_name: Breach Detection; Assessment; and Notification Process
owner_role: Chief Compliance Officer; Chief Information Security Officer
description: Comprehensive end-to-end process for detecting potential security incidents and breaches involving PHI/ePHI; conducting risk assessments to determine if the breach is reportable under HIPAA; notifying affected individuals; regulators; and media within required timelines; documenting all actions; and conducting post-incident reviews.
business_objective: Ensure timely detection and reporting of security incidents and breaches; minimize impact; comply with regulatory requirements; maintain stakeholder trust
key_activities: Breach detection and triage; risk assessment procedures; determination of reportability; drafting notification letters; obtaining legal and compliance review; sending notifications to individuals; media and HHS notification; documentation and post-incident analysis; root cause analysis
related_data_categories: Unsecured PHI in any category; clinical records; demographic data; financial data; identifiers; sensitive information
required_roles: Incident Response Team; Chief Compliance Officer; Chief Information Security Officer; Privacy Officer; Chief Medical Officer; Legal Counsel; Communications Director; Database Administrators (for investigation)
training_requirements: Annual training; Post-incident training; Role-specific training for incident responders; Tabletop exercises; Incident simulation drills
compliance_basis: 45 CFR 164.400-414 (HIPAA Breach Notification Rule); HITECH Section 13402; HITECH Section 13403; State breach notification laws
risk_mitigation: Rapid detection via SIEM and monitoring; thorough risk assessment procedures; documented assessment criteria; timely notification execution; legal review of determinations; post-incident reviews to identify systemic issues; corrective action tracking
metrics_tracked: Breach detection time; notification completion time; percentage of determinations reviewed by legal; individual notifications sent within SLA; regulatory notifications on time; post-incident review completion
incident_history: 2023-01-15: Unauthorized access attempt (4 records affected; notification completed in 48 hours; no regulatory violation); 2024-03-20: Database query anomaly (1 record; no access confirmed; not reportable); 2024-08-10: Email misdirection (5 records; rapid notification and remediation)
automation_status: Mostly Manual; Semi-automated detection; Workflow system for tracking; Email template system; Notification delivery tracking
sla_hours: Individual notifications: 60 hours maximum; Media notification (if applicable): concurrent with individual; HHS notification: 60 calendar days; Initial breach assessment: 2-4 hours; Post-incident review: 30 days
documentation_level: Comprehensive documentation; Breach case files; Assessment worksheets; Notification templates; Legal review records; Communications log; Post-incident reports; Corrective action plans

owner_role: Chief Medical Officer; Chief Medical Information Officer
supporting_owner: Attending Physicians; Clinical Directors; Nursing Leadership
description: Core clinical process for delivering direct patient care using the EHR system including patient registration; vital sign documentation; clinical assessment; diagnosis; treatment planning; medication ordering; test ordering; results review; documentation; and care coordination; ensures accurate; timely; and HIPAA-compliant capture of clinical information.
business_objective: Deliver high-quality; safe; and compliant patient care; ensure accurate clinical documentation; support clinical decision-making; maintain comprehensive patient records
scope: Enterprise-wide clinical operations; all inpatient; outpatient; and emergency departments
key_activities: Patient registration and scheduling; vital sign capture; chief complaint documentation; history and physical examination; assessment and plan documentation; medication order entry; lab and imaging test ordering; results review and acknowledgment; care plan development; referral management; discharge planning; patient education documentation
related_data_categories: Clinical records; lab results; imaging reports; medication information; patient identifiers; vital signs; diagnoses; treatment plans; notes
required_roles: Physicians; Nurses; Nursing Assistants; Clinical Secretaries; Pharmacists; Laboratory Technicians; Imaging Technicians; Case Managers; Medical Records Staff
training_requirements: Initial onboarding training on EHR; annual HIPAA training; clinical specialty training; system updates training; just-in-time training; competency assessments for critical functions
compliance_basis: 45 CFR 164.308-312 (HIPAA Administrative; Physical; Technical Safeguards); 45 CFR 164.500-510 (HIPAA Privacy Rule); HITECH Section 13405 (Privacy Provisions); State medical practice acts; Joint Commission standards; CLIA regulations (for lab); CMS documentation requirements
risk_mitigation: Minimize documentation errors through templates and decision support; enforce access controls to limit viewing to authorized clinicians; encrypt clinical data at rest and in transit; implement audit logging for clinical data access; train staff on privacy and security; enforce minimum necessary access; implement session timeouts; conduct periodic access reviews; incident response procedures for unauthorized access; corrective action for compliance gaps
metrics_tracked: Average documentation time per encounter; number of medication order errors caught by decision support; percentage of test result acknowledgment within SLA; patient safety incidents related to documentation gaps; unauthorized access attempts to patient records; HIPAA compliance audit findings; staff training completion rates; clinician satisfaction with EHR; clinical quality measures
incident_history: 2023-06-20: Duplicate order entry (caught by alert; patient notified; root cause addressed); 2024-02-15: Late result review (policy reminder sent; turnaround time improvement plan); 2024-07-01: Unauthorized chart access attempt (blocked by access controls; incident investigated); 2024-09-10: Documentation completeness improved with new templates (positive outcome)
automation_status: Fully Automated EHR System; Clinical Decision Support; Order Set Templates; Result Routing Automation; Electronic Alerts for Critical Values; Clinical Workflow Automation; Documentation Templates; Medication Dispensing Integration,Continuous (24/7 for emergency; scheduled for routine),Routine orders: 48 hours; Emergency orders: immediate; Medications: before dispensing; Lab results: 24 hours for review; Imaging: 48 hours for report; Discharge summaries: 72 hours after discharge"
frequency_type: Comprehensive clinical documentation; Clinical templates; Order sets; Workflow procedures; Training materials; Audit logs for clinical access; Incident documentation; Compliance audit reports; Quality metrics reports

process_name: Periodic Access Review and Recertification Process
owner_role: Chief Information Security Officer; Identity and Access Management Lead
supporting_owner: Database Administrators; System Owners; Department Managers; Compliance Officer
description: Quarterly access review and recertification process to ensure all users maintain appropriate access levels; unused access is removed; access aligns with current job responsibilities; excess privileges are remediated; and compliance with least-privilege principle is maintained; includes automated reports; management review and approval; and corrective action for non-compliant access.
business_objective: Maintain principle of least privilege; reduce risk of unauthorized access; ensure access aligns with job duties; identify and remove orphaned accounts; maintain compliance with HIPAA and HITECH; detect potential compromise or misuse
scope: All users with system access; all systems containing PHI/ePHI
key_activities: Generate access reports by system and user; identify users with multiple roles or excess privileges; send reports to department managers and system owners; management review and verification of access appropriateness; approval or rejection of continued access; removal of inappropriate access; escalation of exceptions for executive approval; documentation of approvals; quarterly reporting to compliance and security leadership
related_systems: SYSTEM-IDENTITY-ACCESS; SYSTEM-EHR-PROD; SYSTEM-LAB-SYSTEM; SYSTEM-PHARMACY-MGMT; SYSTEM-BILLING-RCM; (all systems with user authentication)
related_data_categories: Access logs; user directory data; role assignments; system access records; (not typically PHI/ePHI in the process itself; protecting metadata)
required_roles: Chief Information Security Officer; Identity and Access Management Lead; Database Administrators; System Owners; Department Managers; Compliance Officer; Executive Sponsors
training_requirements: Annual training for managers on access review procedures; training for IAM staff on escalation and remediation; new manager training on access responsibility
compliance_basis: 45 CFR 164.308(a)(4) (Access Management); HITECH Section 13405 (Privacy Provisions); HITECH Section 13402 (Enforcement); CIS Controls; NIST SP 800-53 (AC-2; AC-6)
risk_mitigation: Automated access reports identify inappropriate access; management review and approval prevents unauthorized access from persisting; escalation procedures flag and remediate orphaned or excessive access; audit logging provides trail for investigation; corrective action tracking ensures follow-up; regular recertification maintains ongoing compliance; exception handling for legitimate business needs
metrics_tracked: Access review completion rate; percentage of access corrected in timely manner; number of users with excess privileges identified and remediated; number of orphaned accounts removed; variance between approved access and actual system access; time to remediate non-compliant access; audit findings related to access control
incident_history: 2023-04-10: 15 users found with multiple role combinations (remediated within SLA); 2024-01-20: 3 orphaned accounts discovered and removed; 2024-06-15: 2 exceptions identified for executive review (both approved with documented business justification); 2024-09-01: Access alignment improved by 22% from prior quarter
automation_status:
Mostly Automated (report generation; data collection); Manual review and approval; Automated enforcement of changes; Ticketing system integration; Escalation workflows,Quarterly (every 90 days); with ad-hoc reviews for major organizational changes or after security incidents,Management review and approval: 2 weeks from report issuance; Corrective action execution: 1 week from approval; Escalation resolution: dependent on business need but target 5 business days,Comprehensive process documentation; Access review procedures; Exception approval workflows; Remediation tracking; Compliance reports; Audit logs of changes; Training materials,Active
PROC-INCIDENT-RESPONSE,Security Incident Response and Investigation Process,Incident Management,Corrective,Chief Information Security Officer; Incident Response Manager"
frequency_type: Security Operations Center Manager; Incident Response Team; Forensic Analyst; Network Administrator; Database Administrator; System Owner; Legal Counsel; Public Relations
sla_hours: Structured incident response process from detection through recovery including incident classification; triage; investigation; containment; eradication; recovery; evidence preservation; stakeholder notification; and post-incident review with lessons learned and corrective action identification.
documentation_level: Rapidly detect; assess; contain; eradicate; and recover from security incidents; minimize impact and damage; preserve evidence for investigation; comply with notification requirements; identify root causes and prevent recurrence
status: Enterprise-wide; all systems and networks; triggered by security events
column26: Incident detection and alerting; initial triage and classification; escalation decisions; incident lead assignment; investigation and scoping; evidence preservation and forensic analysis; containment measures; affected system remediation; recovery and restoration; stakeholder communication; legal review of notifications; incident closure with post-incident review
column29: SYSTEM-SECURITY-INFRASTRUCTURE; SYSTEM-EHR-PROD; SYSTEM-BACKUP-RECOVERY; SYSTEM-IDENTITY-ACCESS; (any affected system)
column30: Incident investigation data; forensic evidence; logs and audit trails; affected PHI/ePHI data; security event information
column31: Chief Information Security Officer; Incident Response Manager; SOC Manager; Forensic Analyst; Network Administrator; Database Administrator; System Owner; Legal Counsel; Communications; Chief Medical Officer (if clinical impact); Chief Compliance Officer
column32: Annual incident response training; tabletop exercises and simulations; role-specific training for responders; incident command system training; new hire training on incident responsibilities; post-incident training after significant incidents
column33: NIST SP 800-61 (Computer Security Incident Handling Guide); NIST SP 800-83 (Guide to Malware Incident Prevention and Handling); 45 CFR 164.308(a)(6) (Incident Response and Reporting); HITECH Section 13402 (Enforcement); HIPAA Security Rule; CIS Controls
column34: Rapid detection through SIEM and monitoring; documented incident procedures and playbooks; trained incident responders; incident command structure for complex incidents; evidence preservation procedures; containment procedures to stop ongoing damage; recovery procedures to restore systems; communication procedures to notify stakeholders promptly; post-incident reviews to improve future response; corrective action tracking; tabletop exercises for preparedness
column35: Time-to-detect (from event to detection); time-to-respond (from detection to response); time-to-contain (from response to containment); time-to-recover (from containment to recovery); number of systems affected; user records impacted; incident severity classification; escalation rate; mean-time-to-recovery; repeat incidents; incident trends

column37:
Fully Automated (detection; alerting; escalation); Semi-automated investigation (data collection; log analysis); Manual response and recovery; Incident ticketing system; Communication automation (alert notifications); Forensic tools integration,On-demand (triggered by incident detection); 24/7 on-call incident response team availability,Initial response: 15 minutes; Investigation completion: 24-48 hours (depends on complexity); Forensic analysis: 48-72 hours; Recovery and restoration: depends on incident impact (target: <4 hours for critical systems); Post-incident review: 30 days after incident closure,Comprehensive incident procedures; Incident playbooks; Forensic procedures; Evidence handling and chain-of-custody; Communication templates; Post-incident review templates; Training materials; Incident metrics and dashboards,Active
PROC-VENDOR-ASSESSMENT,Third-Party Vendor Risk Assessment and Due Diligence Process,Vendor Management,Preventive,General Counsel; Chief Compliance Officer"
column38: Chief Information Security Officer; Procurement Officer; Information Security Analyst; Business Unit Owner
column39: Comprehensive vendor risk assessment and due diligence process for evaluating and approving vendors who will have access to; manage; or process PHI/ePHI; includes vendor classification; security questionnaire completion; third-party security audit review (SOC 2; HITRUST); contract review and Business Associate Agreement (BAA) negotiation; and periodic reassessment.
column40: Identify and mitigate risks from third-party vendors; ensure vendors meet security and privacy requirements; establish contractual protections for PHI/ePHI; maintain compliance with HIPAA Business Associate requirements; reduce supply chain and operational risks
column41: All new vendors; existing vendors with significant access or role changes; annual reassessment of critical vendors; vendors handling PHI/ePHI
column42: Vendor identification and classification (based on PHI access; data sensitivity; criticality); security questionnaire distribution; audit evidence review (SOC 2; HITRUST; ISO 27001); risk scoring and assessment; remediation of identified gaps; BAA negotiation and execution; contract review and approval; security requirements documentation; onboarding of approved vendors; periodic ongoing vendor monitoring; annual reassessment; incident response coordination with vendors
column45: (Vendor systems for management; SYSTEM-EHR-PROD; SYSTEM-LAB-SYSTEM; SYSTEM-BILLING-RCM for vendor integration)
column46: Vendor security questionnaires; audit reports; SOC 2 attestations; HITRUST certifications; contract terms; BAA terms; vendor incident reports; vendor security policies; vendor vulnerability assessment reports; (vendor assessment data is metadata; protecting vendor and organizational risk information)
column47: General Counsel; Chief Compliance Officer; Chief Information Security Officer; Procurement Officer; Information Security Analyst; Business Unit Owner; Finance/Procurement Manager; Vendor or Service Representative
column48: Annual training for procurement staff on vendor risk assessment; training for BAA negotiation; security requirements workshops; new hire training; periodic updates on regulatory changes and emerging threats
column49: 45 CFR 164.502(a) (Business Associate Rule); 45 CFR 164.504(e) (Business Associate Contracts); HITECH Section 13404 (Business Associate Liability); CIS Controls; NIST SP 800-53 (SA-9; SA-12); NIST SP 800-171 (Contractor security)
column50: Vendor classification identifies high-risk vendors requiring thorough assessment; security questionnaires and audit review identify security gaps; risk scoring prioritizes vendors for in-depth review; remediation of identified gaps before contract execution; BAA establishes contractual security and privacy obligations; insurance and liability terms protect organization; ongoing monitoring and reassessment catch emerging risks; incident response procedures with vendors; contract termination clauses allow rapid vendor offboarding if needed
column51: Number of vendors assessed; percentage with SOC 2 or equivalent audit; percentage with executed BAAs; average time-to-approval for low-risk vendors; time-to-approval for high-risk vendors requiring remediation; number of vendors with identified security gaps; percentage of gaps remediated; vendor incident rate; annual reassessment completion rate; vendor complaint or breach incidents
column52: 2023-08-20: Cloud storage vendor SOC 2 audit reviewed (gaps identified; vendor provided remediation plan; approved with conditions); 2024-01-15: Lab testing vendor assessment completed (HITRUST certified; BAA executed; onboarded); 2024-05-10: Telecom vendor reassessment (certification updated; no gaps); 2024-10-01: ERP system vendor vendor selection process (4 vendors assessed; 1 selected; full due diligence in progress)
column53:
Mostly Manual (questionnaire review; audit assessment; negotiation); Semi-automated tracking (vendor inventory system); Spreadsheet-based risk scoring; Email-based communication; Document management for contracts and BAAs; Vendor management portal (in development),New vendor assessment: on-demand (triggered by procurement request); Annual reassessment of existing critical vendors; Ongoing vendor monitoring,New vendor approval: 30-45 days (depending on complexity and remediation needs); BAA execution: 15-30 days from approval; Ongoing vendor reassessment: 90 days of scheduling to completion,Comprehensive vendor assessment procedures; Vendor risk assessment template; Security questionnaire; BAA template; Vendor inventory and risk registry; Audit evidence files; Approved vendor list; Vendor incident log; Training materials,Active
PROC-WORKFORCE-TRAINING,Mandatory Privacy and Security Training Process,Compliance and Training,Preventive,Chief Compliance Officer; Chief Human Resources Officer; Training Manager"
column54: Chief Information Security Officer; Privacy Officer; HR Managers; Training Department; Department Directors
column55: Mandatory privacy; security; and HITECH-specific training program for all workforce members (employees; contractors; consultants) to ensure understanding of privacy rights; security obligations; incident reporting procedures; and compliance with organizational policies; includes initial onboarding training; annual refresher training; role-specific training for high-risk functions; and competency verification.
column56: Build and maintain security and privacy-aware culture; ensure all staff understand privacy rights and security obligations; reduce human error and insider risk; ensure compliance with training requirements; increase incident detection and reporting
column57: All workforce members; contractors; consultants; volunteers; board members; new hires; annual refresher for all
column58: New hire onboarding training (within 30 days); annual refresher training (within calendar year); role-specific training (for clinical staff; IT staff; security roles); just-in-time training (on policy updates; after incidents; for high-risk activities); competency verification through quizzes; training completion tracking; escalation for non-compliance; refresher training after security incidents
column61: SYSTEM-EMAIL-COLLABORATION; SYSTEM-IDENTITY-ACCESS; Learning Management System; Compliance tracking systems; (training delivery via various channels)
column62: Training materials; completion records; quiz scores; competency assessments; attendance records; (training data is metadata; protecting training content and compliance data)
column63: Chief Compliance Officer; Chief Human Resources Officer; Training Manager; Chief Information Security Officer; Privacy Officer; Department Managers; Subject Matter Experts; Trainers; HR staff
column64: Initial onboarding for new hires; annual training for all staff; role-specific training for high-risk positions (clinical staff; IT; security); management training on training responsibilities; trainer training on content delivery; periodic content updates for staff
column65: 45 CFR 164.308(a)(5) (Workforce Training and Sanctions); HITECH Section 13408 (Workforce Training); HIPAA Security Rule; CIS Controls; Organizational privacy and security policies
column66: Training increases awareness and reduces human error (phishing; mishandling of PHI); role-specific training focuses on high-risk functions; competency verification ensures understanding; post-incident training reinforces specific lessons; escalation procedures ensure accountability for non-compliance; repeat offenders identified for disciplinary action; training content regularly updated to address emerging threats and policy changes
column67: Training completion rate (percentage of workforce trained); average quiz score; assessment pass rate; phishing simulation success rate (percentage clicking malicious links); incident rate related to training gaps; staff satisfaction with training; content relevance rating; post-training behavior change assessment; repeat training violations
